context: The Estonian word 'kuju' has multiple related meanings. It can refer to the external shape or form of objects and bodies ('keha kuju' - body shape), three-dimensional sculptures or statues ('pronksist kuju' - bronze statue), a person's appearance or figure ('tüdruku kuju' - girl's figure), a character or personality in literature/theater, or even an image or mental picture. It derives from the verb 'kujundama' (to shape/form) and is related to concepts like structure, appearance, and representation.
